meanings.definition: To make something the main subject or topic.
meanings.sent1: The teacher thematised the importance of recycling in class.
meanings.sent2: The documentary thematised the impact of climate change on wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The party thematised around the idea of superheroes, with everyone dressed up in capes and masks.
meanings.sent4: Her speech thematised the struggles of overcoming adversity, comparing it to climbing a mountain.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibition thematised the beauty of nature through intricate paintings of landscapes.

meanings.definition: To focus on a particular theme or idea.
meanings.sent1: The author thematised the concept of love throughout the novel.
meanings.sent2: The event thematised unity and togetherness among community members.
meanings.sent3: The movie thematised the importance of friendship in a humorous and heartwarming way.
meanings.sent4: His presentation thematised the power of perseverance, likening it to a marathon.
meanings.sent5: The exhibition thematised cultural diversity through vibrant displays of art from different countries.
